intro: Dracaena brachyphylla, commonly known as the short-leaf dracaena, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit and narrow, dark green leaves that are often marked with silver-white stripes. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters at the base of the plant. Dracaena brachyphylla is often cultivated as a decorative indoor plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
